channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Trump says Liz Cheney should have guns trained on her face: 'Let's see how...'
item.description: Trump said Liz Cheney is a "very dumb individual". "She's a radical war hawk. Let's put her with a rifle standing there with nine barrels shooting at her, okay? Let’s see how she feels about it. You know when the guns are trained on her face.” “They’re all war hawks when they’re sitting in Washington in a nice building, saying, ‘Oh gee, let’s send 10,000 troops right in the mouth of the enemy,’” he added.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taiwan cleans up after Typhoon Kong-rey leaves two dead
item.description: Workers cleared fallen trees and shop owners swept up debris in Taiwan on Friday after one of the biggest typhoons to hit the island in decades claimed at least two lives. - Chinese ship grounded - Across the island, workers were up before dawn clearing trees, branches and other debris from roads.

item.title: Pakistan Airlines gets just one bidder, quotes PKR 10 billion for 60% share
item.description: The government's effort to privatise Pakistan International Airlines (PIA) failed as the only bidder, Blue World City, offered PKR 10 billion for a 60% stake, significantly lower than the PKR 85.03 billion minimum. The lack of competition and high government demands discouraged other bidders.

item.title: Mass shooting in Orlando amid Halloween festivities
item.description: A mass shooting in downtown Orlando early Friday caused panic among Halloween partygoers. The incident took place shortly after 1 am, involving several victims. Police and fire departments are investigating, with an update expected at 4:45 am. The number of victims and suspects have not been released yet. Further details are awaited.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Seismic change in Botswana as party that ruled for 58 years loses power
item.description: Botswana's President Mokgweetsi Masisi conceded defeat after 58 years of ruling party dominance, with opposition candidate Duma Boko set to become president. The Umbrella for Democratic Change secured an overwhelming lead as economic challenges and unemployment issues swayed voters. Significant changes loom, with final results expected soon.

item.title: 'Not just Puerto Ricans were offended': Jennifer Lopez joins Harris' rally in Las Vegas
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and Jennifer Lopez appeared together in Las Vegas, urging voters to support Harris. Lopez criticized former President Trump’s recent Madison Square Garden rally, where speakers made offensive jokes about Latinos, including Puerto Ricans. Emphasizing unity, Lopez highlighted her pride as a Puerto Rican-American and her commitment to positive leadership.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Spain floods: Death toll surges to 150, crew search vehicles and flooded structures for bodies
item.description: Search teams in Spain continue to look for victims of catastrophic flash floods that have claimed over 150 lives. The disaster left widespread destruction in Valencia and beyond, washing away vehicles and damaging infrastructure. Rescue operations are ongoing, with many people still unaccounted for. Climate change is cited as a factor for the severity of the storm.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tropical storm Kong-rey moves toward China’s coast after sweeping Taiwan
item.description: Kong-rey, downgraded to a tropical storm, expected to impact Shanghai and eastern China with severe rain and winds on Friday. The storm previously hit Taiwan, causing two deaths and extensive damage. Zhejiang, Fujian halted ferry services while most of Taiwan resumed operations. The storm follows Tropical Storm Trami's deadly path.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy's alleged sex tapes include minors: Key witness claims
item.description: Courtney Burgess testified in the Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs investigation, revealing that Kim Porter provided him with flash drives containing sex tapes, some involving minors. Burgess also shared details of Porter's memoir documenting abuse by Combs. Combs faces charges including sex trafficking, denies wrongdoing, and is detained pending his trial set for May 2025.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Kim Kardashian delete son Saint West's YouTube channel after anti-Harris post?
item.description: Kim Kardashian has removed her eight-year-old son Saint West's YouTube channel after he posted two controversial videos criticizing Vice President Kamala Harris. Saint's videos drew backlash featuring offensive memes and clips. Kardashian, who monitors his content, enforced their agreement rules by taking down his account, highlighting the family's contrasting political affiliations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Office of Sheikh Hasina’s coalition party attacked in Bangladesh, set ablaze
item.description: A violent mob vandalised and set fire to the Jatiya Party's central office in Dhaka after clashes erupted during a torch procession. Protesters condemned the Jatiya Party's ties with the Awami League. Police and army were deployed as the fire was contained. No immediate comment from the Jatiya Party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: NBA superstar LeBron James endorses VP Kamala Harris for Presidential bid
item.description: NBA star LeBron James endorsed Kamala Harris in the US Presidential elections, emphasizing the importance of voting. He shared a video criticizing Trump's statements and actions towards African Americans, highlighting civil rights abuses and racist rhetoric. James, known for his political involvement, has supported Joe Biden in 2020 and Hillary Clinton in 2016.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea says test-fire perfected new solid-fuel missile 'Hwasong-19': What it means
item.description: North Korea tested the Hwasong-19 ICBM, claiming it as the world's strongest with enhanced altitude and flight capabilities. Kim Jong Un described it as a response to national security threats. Officials suggest solid fuel technology was used, offering faster launches. Meanwhile, international criticism arises over North Korea's troop deployment to Russia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian man requests Selena Gomez to say ‘Jai Shree Ram’; see her response
item.description: A video shows a man asking pop star Selena Gomez to chant 'Jai Shree Ram' during a selfie at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival. Selena looks confused and politely replies without chanting. The video, shared during Diwali celebrations on Instagram, sparked negative reactions and went viral on social media, amassing millions of views.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Will strengthen partnership with good friend PM Modi’: Trump's Diwali message to Hindu Americans
item.description: Former President Trump vowed to protect Hindu Americans from the radical left's anti-religion agenda, pledged to strengthen US-India relations, and condemned violence against minorities in Bangladesh. Trump contrasted his administration's policies with those of Biden and Harris, emphasizing economic growth and regulatory reform.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How're world's trees doing? Here's an assessment
item.description: More than one-third of the world's tree species face extinction, according to a comprehensive assessment by the International Union for Conservation of Nature. Island biodiversity is particularly vulnerable. Agriculture, logging, and urbanisation are significant threats, with climate change as an emerging concern. The findings were presented at the UN biodiversity conference in Colombia.

item.title: SpaceX gets into spy game
item.description: The Pentagon's Space Development Agency achieved a significant milestone by successfully using lasers to transmit data at light speed between military satellites, enhancing missile tracking and defense. This marks a pivotal moment for SpaceX, which is now expanding into military and spy satellite construction, raising questions about its dominance and Elon Musk's foreign relations.

item.title: ‘Happy to talk’: Investigators speak to male escorts about Diddy’s infamous ‘freak off’ parties
item.description: The FBI is investigating Sean 'Diddy' Combs' alleged 'Freak Off' sex parties, interviewing male prostitutes about the events, drugs, and participants. The investigation includes seized videos and objects from Combs' homes. Authorities seek to determine whether participants were underage or coerced, while Combs denies wrongdoing, facing serious charges including racketeering and sex trafficking.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Blast kills man in apartment in Greek capital; anti-terrorism probe launched
item.description: An explosion in an Athens apartment resulted in the death of a man and serious injury to a woman. Greek anti-terrorism police are investigating the incident, suspecting an explosive device caused the blast. The explosion severely damaged the building, and fire brigade officials evacuated the injured woman and recovered the man's body.

item.title: Who is Karthik Naralasetty? Indian-American tech innovator who could be Texas’s youngest mayor
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
